column1: Smith and I had a good deal more than dinner to discuss that morning as we rested for twenty minutes from our office labours. He was very much in earnest about his new work
column2: I could see; and I felt
column4: that my own aspirations for success were not nearly as deep-seated as his. He didn't brag
column5: or build absurd castles in the air; but he made no secret of the fact that now he was once in the business he meant to get on
column6: and expected pretty confidently that he would do so.I wished I could feel half as sure of myself. At any rate
column7: I was encouraged by Jack Smith's enthusiasm
column8: and returned at the end of my twenty minutes to my desk with every intention of distinguishing myself at my work. But somehow everything was so novel
column9: and I was so curiously disposed
column10: that I could not prevent my thoughts wandering a good deal
column11: or listening to the constant running fire of small talk that was going on among my fellow-clerks. And this was all the less to be wondered at
column12: since I myself was a prominent topic of conversation.
